intro: Podonephelium davidsonii, commonly known as the Davidson's flax. It is a flowering plant native to the island of Saint Helena in the South Atlantic Ocean. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in compact heads. It grows in rocky, coastal habitats and is adapted to the harsh maritime climate of its native environment. Podonephelium davidsonii is considered a rare and endemic species, highlighting its ecological significance to the region.
